item.title: By: Sarah Cosper
item.dc:creator: Sarah Cosper
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/sarah-now-clara/#comment-362">click</a>.
Is that a prescription?

item.title: By: Sarah Cosper
item.dc:creator: Sarah Cosper
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/sarah-now-clara/#comment-365">Denys</a>.
Your skin looks great, so you're doing something right. I want to look into that Retin-A thing!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Denys.

Your skin looks great, so you’re doing something right. I want to look into that Retin-A thing!

item.title: By: Denys
item.dc:creator: Denys
item.description: I've had the skin tags removed off my skin twice. Wait until you get pregnant (someday). They only get worse. My dermatologist has told me not to wear necklaces or anything that rubs on my skin. I guess friction causes them? Also, I'm not sure how to keep from getting them, but getting them lasered off is no big deal. I would love to try that no-tag stuff that apparently removes them naturally. Regarding anti-aging stuff, I feel like I've been using anti-aging cream forever. I remember that you were the one to tell me that anti-aging cream and lotion are NOT the same thing (was that like 10 years ago?). Duh. Anyway, as I've gotten older, I invest a lot more money in quality anti-aging creams, lotions, soaps, etc. I am using Origins now. And I guess it's okay? I don't know. I can't tell a difference, which is maybe a good thing. Nothing is getting worse (knock on wood!!!). My mom uses Obagi and she has amazing skin. Also, she buys Retin-A (online from Mexico, so you know its the good shit) and uses that about once a week on her face and neck. Also, everyone, don't forget about your neck and chest area. AND your hands. Those two areas, women forget about, but they are the biggest indicators of age. Just look at the Real Housewives. Anyway, that's that. I used a lot of "also"s in this reply. Whatev.
item.content:encoded: I’ve had the skin tags removed off my skin twice. Wait until you get pregnant (someday). They only get worse. My dermatologist has told me not to wear necklaces or anything that rubs on my skin. I guess friction causes them? Also, I’m not sure how to keep from getting them, but getting them lasered off is no big deal. I would love to try that no-tag stuff that apparently removes them naturally. Regarding anti-aging stuff, I feel like I’ve been using anti-aging cream forever. I remember that you were the one to tell me that anti-aging cream and lotion are NOT the same thing (was that like 10 years ago?). Duh. Anyway, as I’ve gotten older, I invest a lot more money in quality anti-aging creams, lotions, soaps, etc. I am using Origins now. And I guess it’s okay? I don’t know. I can’t tell a difference, which is maybe a good thing. Nothing is getting worse (knock on wood!!!). My mom uses Obagi and she has amazing skin. Also, she buys Retin-A (online from Mexico, so you know its the good shit) and uses that about once a week on her face and neck. Also, everyone, don’t forget about your neck and chest area. AND your hands. Those two areas, women forget about, but they are the biggest indicators of age. Just look at the Real Housewives. Anyway, that’s that. I used a lot of “also”s in this reply. Whatev.

item.title: By: click
item.dc:creator: click
item.description: also, further elaboration on the effects of that lotion, when my dad puts it on his spotted ole arms regularly, they get all soft and even colored!
item.content:encoded: also, further elaboration on the effects of that lotion, when my dad puts it on his spotted ole arms regularly, they get all soft and even colored!

item.title: By: click

item.description: also, i feel that you would be very good at naming tv episodes.
item.content:encoded: also, i feel that you would be very good at naming tv episodes.

item.title: By: click
item.dc:creator: click
item.description:
I come from a long line of pale, pasty people who get non-melanoma skin cancers!
My family says the best thing for dark spots and also to reduce the chance of them turning into benign lumps that have to be removed eventually is.....
AmLactin (Ammoniam Lactate 12%. There is an 8 and a 10%---most effective is the 12%)!!!!!
item.content:encoded:
I come from a long line of pale, pasty people who get non-melanoma skin cancers!

My family says the best thing for dark spots and also to reduce the chance of them turning into benign lumps that have to be removed eventually is…..

AmLactin (Ammoniam Lactate 12%. There is an 8 and a 10%—most effective is the 12%)!!!!!

item.title: By: JenW
item.dc:creator: JenW
item.description: I'm turning 30 next year... keep us informed about this anti-aging stuff. You know the girl that didn't know about nail polish base coats won't have a clue.
item.content:encoded: I’m turning 30 next year… keep us informed about this anti-aging stuff. You know the girl that didn’t know about nail polish base coats won’t have a clue.
